page.title: 05GOOLE CEMETARIES
page.content: The{cemetaries}in Goole provide a useful key to the relatively short history of the town. Many of the headstones record titles of Master Mariner, Captain or Shipbuilder - all clues to the town's strong connections with the{sea.} This is further borne{ out by the casualties of the second world war who died at sea or who were in the navy. One monument details how the undefended town suffered in a{Zeppelin raid in the first world war. It is noticeable how many child deaths were occuring at the turn of the century - as many as six in a family. In the grave yard of the parish church at Hook lay mass graves for victims of{cholera}epedemics which broke out in the 19th. century.
